The '''Annual Georgia European Union Summit''' ('''AGEUS''') is a yearly gathering of Georgian and international economic development leaders. It occurs on the first Thursday in November. During its first nine years the event was held in [[Macon, Georgia|Macon]], [[Georgia (U.S. state)|Georgia]], [[United States|USA]]. In 2010 the event moved to [[Athens, Georgia]], home of the [[University of Georgia]].
Founded in 2001 by [[Christopher N. Smith]], attorney and [[Honorary Consul]] of the Kingdom of [[Denmark]] for Georgia, AGEUS serves to bring together select international leaders, both from European and non-European countries, with various Georgian economic, business, and governmental leaders.
The highlight of each year is the AGEUS awards dinner, which numbers about 200 participants. Dignitary guests include prominent Georgia [[Consular Corps]] members and Trade Commissioners. Table sponsors have included such companies as [[UBS AG]], [[Georgia Power]], and the [[Georgia Department of Economic Development]] (GDEcD).
Each year a prominent person either from the [[European Union]] or in the field of economic development presents the keynote speech.
The finale of the event is often the presentation of the [[AGEUS Award for Individual Contribution]] in the field of Georgia economic development, which was begun in 2006, and/or the presentation of the joint AGEUS/GDEcD awards known as the [[Georgia Featured Export Product Awards]], which began in 2007. These awards may or may not be presented each year at the discretion of the awards committee.
== Keynote speakers == * 2001: Herve Goyens, Consul General of Belgium, Atlanta * 2002: Kent Fallesen, Trade Commissioner of Denmark, Atlanta, and one of the first Europeans to become Honorary Georgia Citizen * 2003: Brian Murphey, Director of the European Union Center, The University of Georgia * 2004: Suzanne Kürstein, Executive Director, The Danish American Business Forum, Copenhagen Denmark * 2005: Frank Baker, Deputy Chief of Mission, British Embassy, Washington * 2006: Matti Anttonen, Minister and Deputy Chief of Mission, Embassy of Finland, Washington * 2007: Heidi Green, Deputy Commissioner of the Georgia Department of Economic Development for Global Commerce * 2008: Francois Rivasseau, Deputy Chief of Mission, Embassy of France, Washington * 2009: Claes Hammer, Minister of Economic and Foreign Affairs, Swedish Embassy, Washington * 2010: Dr. Lutz Gorgens, Consul General of the Federal Republic of Germany, Atlanta, Georgia
== AGEUS Award winners == * 2006: Christopher N. Smith for his work bringing Danish companies to Georgia. * 2007: James Blair for his 19 years of ongoing work in Europe on behalf of Georgia business. * 2008: Not awarded. * 2009: Dr. Bruce S. Allen for his work in foreign relations and economic development. * 2010: Not awarded. <!-- <gallery>Image:AGEUS_International_Recognition_Award_2007.jpg|Caption1</gallery> -->
== References == * [http://stories.globalatlanta.com/2007stories/015591.html Global Atlanta story]{{dead link|date=July 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}

'''Aubrey Dan''' (born October 4, 1963) is a Canadian [[businessman]] and [[philanthropist]] as well as a [[theatrical producer|producer]] and [[impresario]].<ref name="PostCity">{{cite web|url=http://postcitymagazines.com/2008-06/story_200806_AubreyDan.php |title=T.O.'s newest theatre mogul on his battle with Mirvish, his favourite musical and why he loves to call North York home |last=Nayman |first=Adam |date=June 2008 |publisher=postcitymagazines.com |accessdate=2009-05-08 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081120095350/http://postcitymagazines.com/2008-06/story_200806_AubreyDan.php |archivedate=November 20, 2008 }}</ref><ref name="IBDB">{{cite web|url=http://www.ibdb.com/person.php?id=446166|title=Aubrey Dan|publisher=Internet Broadway Database|accessdate=2009-05-08}}</ref> He is the son of [[Leslie Dan]], a Canadian [[entrepreneur]] and founder of the generic pharmaceutical manufacturer [[Teva Canada|Novopharm]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://network.nationalpost.com/np/blogs/francis/archive/2009/01/17/jersey-boys-showbiz-and-aubrey-dan.aspx |title=Jersey Boys, showbiz and Aubrey Dan |last=Francis |first=Diane |date=January 17, 2009 |publisher=National Post |accessdate=2009-05-08 }}{{dead link|date=October 2016 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> He graduated from the University of Western Ontario and received a Bachelor of Management and Organizational Studies. The department was later renamed after Aubrey Dan in 2006, and is now called the DAN Department of Management & Organizational Studies.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://dan.uwo.ca/news/2017/DAN_management__renamed.html|title=DAN Department of Management & Organizational Studies named in honour of Aubrey Dan.|last=|first=|date=|website=|access-date=}}</ref>
==Business ventures== According to the Dancap website, Dan founded a number of companies under the Dancap moniker including: Dancap Private Equity, Dancap Global Asset Management, [[Dancap Productions]] and Dancap Catering.<ref name="Dancap">{{cite web|url=http://www.dancap.ca/team.htm|title= Dancap Profile/Team |publisher=Dancap Private Equity Inc.|accessdate=2009-05-08}}</ref>
==Philanthropy== As a philanthropist, Dan has donated millions to various charitable organizations including: $5 million to the Baycrest Centre Foundation;<ref name="Baycrest">{{cite web|url=http://www.baycrest.org/News_and_Media/News_Releases_2004/default_6771.asp |title=$5-million gift to Baycrest honors father - Baycrest |publisher=Baycrest Center |accessdate=2009-05-08 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090813032202/http://www.baycrest.org/News_and_Media/News_Releases_2004/default_6771.asp |archivedate=2009-08-13 |df= }}</ref> $8 million to the Sunnybrook Foundation's Centre for High Risk Mothers & Babies;<ref name="TorStar">{{cite news|url=https://www.thestar.com/News/GTA/article/307889|title=Sunnybrook gets $8M gift|last=Rush |first=Curtis |date=Feb 28, 2008|publisher=The Toronto Star|accessdate=2009-05-08}}</ref> and $350,000 to Ontario Wound Care Inc. for the [[hyperbaric]] oxygen treatment of diabetic wounds.<ref name="OntarioWoundCare">{{cite web|url=http://www.newswire.ca/en/releases/archive/March2007/22/c5341.html|title=New clinic treats diabetic wounds, prevents amputations |publisher=CNW Group Ltd. |accessdate=2009-05-08}}</ref>
On 7 April 2016, the School of Drama and Music at [[Queen's University]] was renamed the Dan School of Drama and Music in recognition of a $5-million donation from Dan, whose daughter is a graduate of the school's Drama program.<ref>http://www.queensjournal.ca/story/2016-04-07/arts/school-of-drama-and-music-receives-5-million-donation/</ref>
==Awards and recognition== Additional accolades for Dan include an [[Honorary degree|honorary Doctorate of Laws Degree]] from [[Assumption University (Windsor)|Assumption University]] in 2008.<ref name="Daiji">{{cite web|url=http://www.daijiworld.com/news/news_disp.asp?n_id=46614&n_tit=Akshay+Kumar+Conferred+PhD+by+Canada+University|title=Akshay Kumar Conferred PhD by Canada University|publisher=Daijiworld.com|accessdate=2009-05-08}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== *[http://www.dancap.ca/team.htm Dancap website and Aubrey Dan Bio]

[[Saad Hariri]] (half-brother) |website = }} '''Ayman Rafic Hariri''' (born 16 May 1978){{cite web| url=http://dirigeants.bfmtv.com/Ayman-HARIRI-3928527/| title=Ayman Hariri | publisher= [[BFM TV]]| accessdate= 10 May 2016|quote= Ayman HARIRI est né le 16 mai 1978. / Ayman Hariri was born on 16 May 1978.| language=french | archivedate= 10 May 2016| archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160510225444/http://dirigeants.bfmtv.com/Ayman-HARIRI-3928527/ | deadurl=no}} is a Lebanese [[billionaire]] heir and businessman, the second-youngest son of tycoon [[Rafic Hariri]]. ==Early life== Ayman Hariri is the second-youngest son of [[Rafic Hariri]]. He has a bachelor's degree in computer science from [[Georgetown University]] in the US.{{cite web|title=Executive Profile Ayman Rafic Al-Hariri|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/private/person.asp?personId=13291102&privcapId=1611621|website=Bloomberg|accessdate=15 November 2015}} ==Career== He was the deputy CEO and deputy chairman of [[Saudi Oger]], one of the largest construction companies in Saudi Arabia, which closed in 2017,{{cite web|url=http://gulfbusiness.com/struggling-construction-firm-saudi-oger-shuts-report/|title=Struggling construction firm Saudi Oger shuts down - report|author=|date=31 July 2017|website=gulfbusiness.com|accessdate=5 August 2017}} allegedly due to mismanagement and corruption.{{cite web|url= http://www.arabnews.com/node/936796/saudi-arabia|title=Saudi Oger Ltd.Angry workers burned vehicles}} In 2007, ''[[Reuters]]'' reported that the French President [[Jacques Chirac]] on leaving office would move into an apartment in Paris, opposite the Louvre museum, that would be lent to Chirac and his wife by Ayman Hariri.{{cite news|title=Chirac to move into Hariri family apartment|url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/2007/04/25/uk-france-chirac-apartment-idUKL2564647020070425|accessdate=15 November 2015|work=Reuters|date=25 April 2007}} As of February 2018, ''[[Forbes]]'' estimated his net worth at US$1.33 billion. ==Personal life== He is married, with three children and lives in [[Riyadh]], [[Saudi Arabia]]. ==Controversy== In late February 2018, Hariri's social media company, [[Vero (app)|Vero]], saw a marked increase in usership and scrutiny{{cite web|title=As Vero Blows Up, Backlash Builds Against Social App’s ‘Shady’ Founder|url=https://www.thedailybeast.com/as-vero-blows-up-backlash-builds-against-shady-social-app|accessdate=28 February 2018|work=Daily Beast|date=February 28, 2018}}. This focused especially on Hariri's own association with Saudi Oger at the time of its failure to pay its migrant workers in November 2015.{{cite web|url= http://www.arabnews.com/node/936796/saudi-arabia|title=Saudi Oger Ltd.Angry workers burned vehicles|accessdate=28 February 2018}} According to a statement to USA Today and Gizmodo{{cite news|title=Delete Vero? A movement has already started to ax the new social app|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/tech/talkingtech/2018/02/28/delete-vero-movement-has-already-started-ax-new-social-app/380519002/|accessdate=28 February 2018|work=USA Today|date=February 28, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://gizmodo.com/we-regret-to-inform-you-that-vero-is-bad-1823389901|title=We Regret to Inform You That Vero Is Bad [Updated]|accessdate=28 February 2018|work=Gizmodo|date=February 28, 2018}} from Vero, he ceased duties as deputy CEO and deputy chairman of his family's construction company in 2013. However, Gizmodo found references to his still being in those positions as late as February 2016, after the company's offense,{{cite news|title=Impossible Collection: Billionaire Ayman Hariri wants to share his rare DC comic book collection with you|url=http://www.ibtimes.co.uk/impossible-collection-billionaire-ayman-hariri-wants-share-his-rare-dc-comic-book-collection-you-1551293|accessdate=28 February 2018|work=International Business Times|date=March 30, 2016}}{{cite web|title=Endurance|url=https://www.forbesmiddleeast.com/en/endurance/|accessdate=28 February 2018|work=Forbes|date=7 May 2015}} including in one of Vero's press releases.{{cite web|title=Next-generation social platform provides new opportunities for British fashion designers to connect more meaningfully with their customers|url=https://www.vero.co/press-release/2016/2/17/feature-angle-next-generation-social-platform-provides-new-opportunities-for-british-fashion-designers-to-connect-more-meaningfully-with-their-customers|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180228184043/https://www.vero.co/press-release/2016/2/17/feature-angle-next-generation-social-platform-provides-new-opportunities-for-british-fashion-designers-to-connect-more-meaningfully-with-their-customers|archive-date=February 28, 2018|dead-url=no|accessdate=28 February 2018|date=February 17, 2016}} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Hariri, Ayman}} [[Category:1970s births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Hariri family|Ayman]] [[Category:Lebanese billionaires]] [[Category:Lebanese businesspeople]] [[Category:Saudi Arabian people of Lebanese descent]] [[Category:Lebanese people of Palestinian descent]]

(1967-09-20)]] The '''[[Beijing]] [[Central Business District]]''', or '''Beijing CBD''' ({{zh|s=北京商务中心区|t=北京商務中心區|p=Běijīng Shāngwù Zhōngxīn Qū}}), is the primary area for [[finance]], [[Mass media|media]], and business services in [[Beijing]], [[China]].<ref>Latimer D. (2014) ''The Improbable Beijing Guidebook'', Sinomaps, Beijing, {{ISBN|978-7-5031-8451-2}}, p.76</ref>
Beijing CBD occupies 3.99 km<sup>2</sup> of the [[Chaoyang District, Beijing|Chaoyang District]] on the east side of the city. Geographically situated to the east of the city center, sandwiched between the [[3rd Ring Road (Beijing)|3rd Ring Road]] and the [[4th Ring Road]], the Beijing CBD is currently undergoing large-scale development.
==Economic history and importance== As Beijing is becoming one of the most important [[international financial center]]s in China, Beijing CBD was recently positioned as the secondary core area in Beijing's International Financial Center Development strategic plan published in May, 2008. Beijing CBD is also emerging as China's media center as [[Beijing Television]] Station (BTV) just moved in its new headquarters ([[Beijing TV Centre]]) in this area and the new [[CCTV Headquarters]] was officially opened on 15 June 2008 [[night]].
In the eight years since the government decided to speed up construction of the district, the Beijing CBD has attracted 117 Fortune 500 businesses in the financial, media, information technology, consulting and service industries. More than 60 percent of overseas-funded companies in Beijing are in the CBD. A majority of foreign embassies in Beijing - the No 1, No 2 and No 3 [[embassy]] districts are now concentrated in the Beijing CBD and its neighboring areas.
The Beijing CBD Administrative Committee, established in 2001, is in charge of planning and management and aims to facilitate investments and improve the work environment for professionals.The committee provides information to investors on laws, taxes and state policies as well as a one-stop service, which has simplified approval procedures and raised efficiency.
The establishment of the Beijing CBD Chamber of Finance, the Beijing CBD Chamber of Media Industry and Beijing CBD Association of Property Management & Real Estate Development has facilitated communication and cooperation between the government and enterprises. The Beijing CBD International Business Festival and Beijing CBD International Forum have put the Beijing CBD on the map worldwide.

{{EngvarB|date=September 2015}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2015}} {{Advert|date=November 2009}} {{Infobox Organization |name = Business Link |image = Business Link.png |size = 100px |alt = Business Link Logo |caption = |abbreviation = BL |formation = 1993 |status = [[Non-profit organization|Non-profit service]] |purpose = Business support in England |location = England, in nine regional offices |region_served = England |membership = |leader_title = n/a |leader_name = |main_organ = |parent_organization = |affiliations = |budget = £105m (over 3 years) }} {{PoliticsUK}} '''Business Link''' was a government-funded business advice and guidance service in England. It consisted of an online portal managed by [[HM Revenue and Customs]] (HMRC) and a national telephone helpline.
The network of local/regional advisors (under the auspices of the [[Department for Business, Innovation and Skills]]) was axed in 2011. The online portal was replaced (along with [[Directgov]]) by the [[GOV.UK|Gov.uk]] website on 17 October 2012, although the telephone helpline was retained.
This government programme is not to be confused with Business Link Magazine Group, a magazine publisher founded in 1988.
==Origins and launch== The concept for Business Link was established in December 1992 by [[Michael Heseltine]], then President of the Board of Trade, when he was in charge of the [[Department of Trade and Industry (United Kingdom)|Department of Trade and Industry]] and was initially referred to as "One Stop Shop".<ref name="closure">{{cite web|last1=Tyler|first1=Richard|title=Business Link scrapped and replaced by call centre|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/yourbusiness/8093448/Business-Link-scrapped-and-replaced-by-call-centre.html|publisher=The Telegraph|accessdate=5 March 2016|date=28 October 2010}}</ref>
At the time research for the Competitiveness Agenda led Government to believe small businesses were reluctant to invest in growth, that they failed to plan ahead and invest in training, that they were swamped with paperwork and relied on too few customers. These barriers to growth were the driving forces behind the need for a Business Link type solution.<ref>{{cite book|last=Forte|first=Elliot|title=Intervention: The Battle for Better Business|date=17 December 2011|publisher=Lulu|isbn=978-1447863236|pages=13–264|url=http://www.battleforbetterbusiness.co.uk}}</ref>
The Enterprise Initiative ran from 1988 to 1994. This Government funded scheme was designed to encourage take of up external advice (consultancy) by small businesses. This initiative offered grant incentives for small businesses to use consultants. During this three-year period applications were received from 135,700 businesses. A Wren and Storey report concluded that £1,000 of grant assistance increased sales in a business by £30,000 and created a new job. An alternative study by Bennett and Robson estimated that take up of external advice trebled in small businesses with the incentive of grant provision. The Enterprise Initiative compounded support for intervention in the small business market place.
"I knew that there were very large numbers of small and medium sized enterprises out there who were running on the most rudimentary systems. If they had a problem, many of them didn't come from a background where they knew of anyone who could help or advise them. We wanted a team of people who could hold their hand, listen to their problems, have a working knowledge of what business is about, make suggestions, ask questions and be a friend in need." Heseltine<ref>{{cite book|last=Forte|first=Elliot|title=Intervention: The Battle for Better Business|date=17 December 2011|publisher=Lulu|isbn=978-1447863236|pages=23–263|url=http://www.battleforbetterbusiness.co.uk}}</ref>
===Resistance=== Despite being a Conservative sponsored initiative with apparent cross party support, the proposal for a Government funded One Stop Shop immediately hit political resistance.
Reflecting on this period in 2011 Heseltine stated that "you would have the left wing, which wouldn't have any real interest in effective management of the capitalist system. And you would have a very powerful element on the right wing of politics that would think it's a matter for the capitalist system to manage itself and government intervention, as they would call it, would be very unattractive. In truth, when I did it, I did comprehensive presentations to Conservative back benchers so that they could see what I believed an industrial policy was about. What they felt it was likely to be about were things like backing winners, or subsidising losers. Now I wasn't in favour of certainly the latter, but once I had done the presentations, I had no complaints."<ref>{{cite book|last=Forte|first=Elliot|title=Intervention: The Battle for Better Business|date=17 December 2011|publisher=Lulul|isbn=978-1447863236|pages=254–264|url=http://www.battleforbetterbusiness.co.uk}}</ref>
Initially Heseltine approached the private sector to deliver a Business Link type service, specifically the [[British Chambers of Commerce]]. However, these meetings were unsuccessful. The reasons for this failure are disputed, however Heseltine stated that Chambers "should have set up this combined advisory service. They should have gone to Government and said, look you've got all these services, work with us and create the one stop shop. That's what they should have done. We did it for them. I think they regarded Business Link as an intrusion into their fiefdom. But the reason we created Business Link was because the Chambers weren't doing a good enough job. So there was tension there from the beginning."<ref>{{cite book|last=Forte|first=Elliot|title=Intervention: The Battle for Better Business|date=17 December 2011|publisher=Lulul|isbn=978-1447863236|pages=252–264|url=http://www.battleforbetterbusiness.co.uk}}</ref>
===Challenges creating the network=== The Department of Trade (DTI) predicted 54 Business Links would launch by the end of 1993. Progress was much slower than anticipated due to each bidder and proposal having to be evaluated by a National Assessment Panel. Achieving and maintaining the ISO 9001 Quality Management Standard and Investors in People was a mandatory requirement and each new organisation (Business Link Operator) who, if successful, was granted a three-year operating license. By the end of 1993 (during which time the government spent some £3m on the programme), only three branches of the service had been formed. The first opened in Leicester on 27 September 1993, with others following in Birmingham and [[Congleton]]. Halfway through 1994 only 21 Business Link Operators were in place.
At the end of 1996 the Government finally completed the national roll-out, establishing a total of 89 new Business Link partnerships overseeing 240 advice centres throughout England. Each week some 10,000 businesses in England were using the service.
===Market confusion=== The Business Link network initially employed 650 personal business [[Financial advisor|advisors]] (PBAs), who worked primarily with businesses that employed between 10 and 249 people (Small and Medium Sized Enterprises). In February 1996 the Institute of Directors published a research paper declaring that their members were worried about the declared focus on growth business employing between 10 and 249 persons, because this might hurt smaller businesses and disadvantage start ups. However, contrary to popular belief at the time, businesses of all sizes were able to access Business Link services from the start. In November 1996, Richard Page, the Minister for Small Business, Industry and Energy, stated in the House of Commons that he was "disturbed to hear that the impression has been given that we are not there to help all businesses irrespective of size. My clear message is that Business Link is there to help any business man or woman, irrespective of size of company, because from little acorns grow the big oak trees".
This contradiction may be explained by the DTI directive requiring the individual new Business Link partnerships to generate at least 25% of their income from outside central Government within five years of launch, with the express advice that the most likely source would be the end consumers. As a result, the Business Links wanted their PBAs to work with growth-oriented businesses but this proved difficult to enforce and implement.<ref>Mole, K. (2002) 'Street-Level Technocracy in UK Small Business Support: Business Links, Personal Business Advisers and the Small Business Service’. Environment and Planning C: Government and Policy, 20(2), 179–194</ref> PBAs were recruited from those who ran businesses. At first some were self-employed earning commission but this did not prove to be self-sustaining.<ref>Priest, S.J. (1999). Business Link services to small and medium-sized enterprises: Targeting, innovation and charging. Environment and Planning C, 17, 177–93.</ref> Early business support in Scotland was called Scottish Business Shop. In Wales the name was Business Connect, and in Northern Ireland it was called the Local Enterprise Development Unit.
==Services== ===Regional network=== Business Link’s face-to-face service operated on a [[Regions of England|regional]] basis across England and was funded by the relevant [[regional development agency|regional development agencies]] (RDAs). The service used an IDBT (information, diagnostic, brokerage and transaction) model to advise businesses. Regional Business Links ran a variety of events and workshops on topical issues and general business skills.
This service was evaluated on a number of occasions<ref>Bennett, R. J. and Robson, P. J. A. (1999) 'Intensity of Interaction in Supply of Business Advice and Client Impact: A Comparison of Consultancy, Business Associations and Government Support Initiatives for SMEs’. British Journal of Management 10 , 351–369. Bennett, R.J, Robson, P.J.A. and Bratton, W.J.A. (2001) Government advice networks for SMEs: An assessmsnt of the influence of local context on Business Link use, impact and satisfaction, Applied Economics, 33(7): 871–885. Mole, K.F., Hart, M., Roper, S., and Saal, D. (2008). Differential gains from Business Link Support and Advice: A treatment effects approach. Environment and Planning C: Government and Policy, 26, 315–34. Mole, K.F., Hart, M., Roper, S., and D. Saal. (2009). Assessing the Effectiveness of Business Support Services in England: Evidence from a Theory Based Evaluation. International Small Business Journal, 27, 557–582. Roper S, Hart, M, 2005 ‘Small Firm Growth And Public Policy In The UK: What Exactly are the Connections?’ Working Paper, Aston Business School (RP0504)</ref>
These assessments generally found positive impacts of Business Link on companies that received advice. However, some commentators worried about the cost of Business Link and the variability of advice.<ref>Bennett, R.J. and Robson P.J.A.. (2003) ‘Changing use of external business advice and Government support during the 1990s’. Regional Studies, 37, 795–811</ref> Some of the Business Links were chosen to provide more intensive support to fewer companies and these seemed to do comparatively well. Other Business Links showed less success with a 'spreading the jam thinly model'<ref>Mole, K.F., Hart, M., Roper, S., and D. Saal. (2011) Broader or Deeper? Exploring the most effective intervention profile for public small business support, Environment and Planning A vol. 43 no 1 pp 87 – 105</ref>
The Business Link regional advisory service offered advice and support to businesses until November 2011.<ref>{{cite web|title=Business Link|url=http://www.businesslink.gov.uk/aboutus|accessdate=30 March 2011}}</ref> It was then abolished along with the [[regional development agency|regional development agencies]] (RDAs). The Business Link website and the national helpline continued to operate. [[Local enterprise partnership]]s (LEPs) will be expected to drive regional economic growth in the absence of the Business Link regional advisory service.<ref>{{cite web|title=Department for Business Innovation and Skills, Local Enterprise Partnerships|url=http://www.bis.gov.uk/policies/economic-development/leps|accessdate=30 March 2011}}</ref>
Various business link companies have engaged in direct competition with the private sector and with Governmental organisations such as ACAS. This includes the provision of employment law advice directly to businesses via cold calling, mail shots, emails and their websites. However, evaluations of Business Link showed that those taking advice from Business Link were thereafter more likely to work with private consultants as they learned about the benefits of advice<ref>Mole K.F., Hart M., Roper S., and Saal D. (2009) "Assessing the Effectiveness of Business Support Services in England: Evidence from a Theory Based Evaluation" International Small Business Journal Vol 27, no. 5, pp. 557–582</ref>
=== Website === [[File:Business Link website.png|thumb|The Business Link website in September 2012]] The Business Link website was launched in May 2004 as part of the [[Transformational Government]] programme (an initiative to consolidate UK government websites). In 2010 it emerged that the site cost £35m a year to build and operate (totaling £105m so far).<ref>{{cite web|last= BBC|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/blogs/thereporters/rorycellanjones/2010/07/the_105m_website.html|title=The £105m website}}</ref> It was administered by the private company [[Serco]], on behalf of the government.
Information on the site came in the form of ''guides'' (pages of text information), ''interactive tools'' (in which businesses could get personalised information) and ''transactions'' (in which businesses could for example, calculate their VAT).
In 2010 the website launched an experimental wiki on some of the guides to allow visitors to add their own content.<ref>{{cite web|title=Experimental Wiki|url=http://www.businesslink.gov.uk/bdotg/action/detail?site=210&itemId=1085516912&type=ONEOFFPAGE|accessdate=27 July 2010}}{{dead link|date=July 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> This experiment ran until the end of September 2010.
==Closure== Despite the evidence that it was the advisers who contributed to the impact of Business Link,<ref>Mole, K.F., Hart, M., Roper, S., Saal.D. (2009). Assessing the Effectiveness of Business Support Services in England: Evidence from a Theory Based Evaluation. International Small Business Journal, 27, 557–582. Mole, K.F., Hart, M., Roper, S., Saal, D. (2008). Differential gains from Business Link Support and Advice: A treatment effects approach. Environment and Planning C: Government and Policy, 26, 315–34. </ref> the Coalition government, elected in 2010, declared their intention to abolish the regional business adviser programs run by Business Link.<ref name="closure" /> New local enterprise partnerships would take their place but the national website and telephone service would continue.
The website was replaced by the [[Gov.uk]] public information website on 17 October 2012. Content was migrated to the new website, maintaining previous links to redirect users.
==Similar services== Business Link only operated in England. The remainder of the UK still has similar regional services:
* [[Business Gateway]], Scotland<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bgateway.com |title=Business Link | Scottish Enterprise |publisher=Bgateway.com |date= |accessdate=21 December 2010}}</ref> * NIbusinessinfo.co.uk, Northern Ireland (run by [[Invest Northern Ireland]])<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nibusinessinfo.co.uk |title=Business Link | investNI |publisher=Nibusinessinfo.co.uk |date= |accessdate=21 December 2010}}</ref> * Flexible Support for Business, Wales.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fs4b.wales.gov.uk |title=Business support, information and advice | business.wales.gov.uk |publisher=Fs4b.wales.gov.uk |date= |accessdate=21 December 2010}}</ref>
Regional providers used a rebranded version of the Business Link website. The Northern Ireland website has retained the vast majority of the Business Link website information.
Most OECD countries provide similar services although they may organise them differently. Examples are the SBDC in the USA and ALMI in Sweden.<ref>Mole K and Bramley G. (2006) Making policy choices in non-financial business support: An International Comparison, Environment and Planning C., 24, 6, 885–908</ref>
==See also== * [[Federation of Small Businesses]]

{{Infobox person | birth_name = Carl Wilhelm Andreas Falck | name = Carl Falk | birth_date = {{Birth date|1907|5|27|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Tønsberg]], [[Norway]] | death_place = [[Oslo]], Norway | death_date = {{Death date|df=yes|2016|07|23}}
(aged {{age in years and days|1907|05|27|2016|07|23}}) | alma_mater = [[University of Oslo]] | occupation= Businessman, CEO | known for= Norway's oldest living man | Parent(s)= | children= }} '''Carl Wilhelm Andreas Falck''' (27 May 1907 – 23 July 2016{{Cite web|url=http://norwaytoday.info/news/norways-oldest-man-dead/|title=Norway's oldest man is dead|last=Tatone|first=Joseph|date=25 July 2016|website=norwaytoday.info|publisher=Norway Today|language=en-US|access-date=2016-07-25}}) was a Norwegian businessman, [[centenarian]], and Norway's oldest living man. He was head of the [[wholesale]]rs' organization Norges Grossistforbund from 1948 to 1975. At the age of 105, Falck became Norway's oldest man in 2012 and a subject of media interest. ==Early years and career== Falck was born in [[Tønsberg]], South Norway to a bookseller and his wife. He got a master's degree in law (''[[cand.jur.]]'') in 1931 at the [[University of Oslo]] and subsequently held various positions as jurist in the [[Norwegian Police Service]], a deputy judge ({{lang-no|dommerfullmektig|links=no}}), assistant lawyer and as jurist in the [[Ministry of Social Affairs (Norway)|Ministry of Social Affairs]]. After 1939, he mostly worked within various business organisations.[http://runeberg.org/hvemerhvem/1973/0148.html "Hvem er Hvem?" (1973), p. 148] Runeberg.org; retrieved 5 January 2014 {{no icon}} In 1948, he was named CEO of the wholesalers' organization Norges Grossist-forbund, (which in 1990 was merged into the [[Federation of Norwegian Enterprises]]). In this position and as part of the [[Marshall Plan]], he spent two months in large cities in the US in 1952 to study the American wholesale industry. He became particularly interested in how the Americans kept stock in big one-level warehouses, as opposed to the Norwegian practice where stocks often were kept in narrow multilayer warehouses where ladders were needed to get the stocks in and out. Coming back to Norway, he advocated what he thought was the more effective American system. He published a book about structural changes in the wholesaler industry in 1969. He was a member of various Norwegian and European committees during his career.Marita E. Valvik (13 April 2013) [http://www.aftenposten.no/okonomi/Lagersjefen-Carl-Falck-7172836.html#.UsisULTeDIU "Lagersjefen Carl Falck"] ''[[Aftenposten]]''; retrieved 5 January 2014 {{no icon}} ==Elderly years and death== In 2012, at age 105, Falck became Norway's oldest man and since then was portrayed by various media outlets. Remaining in good health, he lived in his own home until 2012. when he moved into a nursing home in Oslo. He used to smoke until he was around 50. In his eighties, he started going to a gym, and later worked out daily at the nursing home.Hilde Nordlund (24 August 2012) [http://www.dagbladet.no/2012/08/24/tema/helse/eldre/trening/velvere/23109764/ "Norges nest eldste mann synes damene på senteret er for gamle"] ''[[Dagbladet]]''. Retrieved 5 January 2014 {{no icon}} In 2013, [[NRK]] published an article by Carl Falck titled "Some thoughts from Norway's oldest man" ({{lang|no|Noen tanker fra Norges eldste mann}}) where he reflected upon his own life and how society had changed since he was born.Carl Falck (12 June 2013) [http://www.nrk.no/ytring/noen-tanker-fra-norges-eldste-mann-1.11076691 "Noen tanker fra Norges eldste mann"] NRK. Retrieved 5 January 2014 {{no icon}} The article was widely spread in [[social media]].[http://www.nrk.no/kultur/_-hyggelig-hvis-det-gleder-andre-1.11078491 "Hyggelig hvis det kan være til glede for andre mennesker"] [[NRK]]; retrieved 5 January 2014 {{no icon}} Commenting on the [[Norwegian parliamentary election, 2013|2013 Norwegian parliamentary election]], he noted that women didn't have the right to vote when he was born. He encouraged people to use their right to vote and declared he would vote the same party as he always had; he voted for the 43rd time in 2013.Astrid Johanne Karstensen (7 September 2013) [http://www.dagbladet.no/2013/09/07/magasinet/pluss/norges_eldste_mann/reportasjen/valg/29067889/ "Mandag stemmer Norges eldste mann, Carl Falck (106), på samme parti for 43. gang"] ''Dagbladet''; retrieved 5 January 2014 {{no icon}} His family lived at [[Eiksmarka]] for several years,{{cite news|title=Urgammel mann kjøper ny klokke|last=Hvaal|first=Sidsel|date=7 December 2012|work=Budstikka|pages=28–29|language=Norwegian}} then at [[Frogner]].{{cite news|title=80 år|date=27 May 1987|work=Aftenposten|page=18|language=Norwegian}} His wife died in 2010.Tom Henry Vestreng (10 January 2013) [http://www.dagsavisen.no/samfunn/105-ar-og-fortsatt-pa-druen/ "105 år – og fortsatt på Druen"] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140305085906/http://www.dagsavisen.no/samfunn/105-ar-og-fortsatt-pa-druen/ |date=March 5, 2014 }} ''[[Dagsavisen]]''. Retrieved 5 January 2014 {{no icon}} He had children and grandchildren. He died on {{start date|2016|07|23|df=y}} at the age of 109 years, 57 days in [[Oslo]]. ==Publications== *Carl Falck: ''Strukturendringene i Varehandelen Og Virkningen for Industrien'' (1969), Grundt Tanum. ==References== {{reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Falck, Carl}} [[Category:1907 births]] [[Category:2016 deaths]] [[Category:Norwegian businesspeople]] [[Category:Norwegian centenarians]] [[Category:University of Oslo alumni]] [[Category:People from Tønsberg]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=February 2015}} {{Infobox newspaper | name = Dagens industri | logo =https://web.archive.org/web/20161208235242/http://www.di.se/play/dist/1480606833544/img/di-logo.svg | image = SE-DSX special paint scheme Dagens Industri.JPG | caption = One of [[Malmö Aviation]]'s Avros in the special "Dagens Industri" livery. | type = | format = [[tabloid (newspaper format)|Tabloid]] | owners = [[Bonnier Group|Bonnier AB]] | founder = | publisher = | editor = | chiefeditor = Peter Fellman | assoceditor = | maneditor = Jonas Jonsson | newseditor = | managingeditordesign = | campuseditor = | campuschief = | opeditor = | sportseditor = | photoeditor = | staff = | foundation = {{start date and age|1976}} | political = Independent [[Liberal conservatism|liberal-conservative]] | language = [[Swedish language|Swedish]] | ceased publication = | headquarters = Stockholm, Sweden | circulation = 101,700 (2010) | sister newspapers = | ISSN = 0346-640X | oclc = | website = [http://di.se/ http://di.se/] }} '''''Dagens Industri''''' (often referred to as '''Di''' and stylized as '''Dagens industri''') is a [[financial newspaper]] in [[tabloid (newspaper format)|tabloid]] format published in [[Stockholm]], [[Sweden]].<ref name=ne />
==History and profile== ''Dagens industri'' was founded in 1976<ref>{{cite web|author=Håkan Lindgren|title=On Virgin Soil. Entrepreneurship in Swedish Financial Journalism in the 1960s and 1970s|url=http://www.helsinki.fi/iehc2006/papers2/Lindgren.pdf|work=Helsinki|accessdate=18 November 2014|format=Conference paper|date=2006}}</ref><ref name=had>{{cite journal|author1=Stig Hadenius|author2=Lennart Weibull|title=The Swedish Newspaper System in the Late 1990s. Tradition and Transition|journal=Nordicom Review|date=1999|volume=1|issue=1|url=http://www.nordicom.gu.se/sites/default/files/kapitel-pdf/31_hadenius-weibull.pdf|accessdate=31 December 2014}}</ref> with two issues per week. In 1983 it increased its [[Frequency|periodicity]] to five issues per week<ref name=had/> and to six in 1990.<ref name=mgraf/> It has since started affiliate newspapers in [[Austria]], [[Estonia]], [[Latvia]], [[Lithuania]], [[Poland]], [[Russia]], [[Scotland]] and [[Slovenia]]. ''Dagens Industri'' is owned by the Swedish family-owned media group [[Bonnier AB]]<ref name=swi/><ref name="bon"/> and is published in [[tabloid format]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Newspapers Next Generation|url=http://bdu.nu/wp-content/uploads/2011/03/Newspaper-next-generation-2009.pdf|date=2009|work=Boström Design and Development|accessdate=12 February 2015}}</ref>
The stated position of the editorial page is independent [[Liberal conservatism|liberal-conservative]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Ledare: Busch Thor gör SD till ett borgerligt parti|url=http://omni.se/ledare-busch-thor-gor-sd-till-ett-borgerligt-parti/a/emGda|work=Omni|accessdate=9 August 2017}}</ref> The newspaper's online edition, ''di.se'', has been voted as Sweden's "best economics online site" 17 years in a row between 1999 och 2016, in a competition held by the PR-firm Hallvarsson & Halvarsson.<ref name="di"/>
In January 2016, former Managing Editor Lotta Edling succeeded Peter Fellman as the Editor-in-chief of ''Dagens industri''.<ref name="bon">{{cite web|title=Dagens industri|url=http://www.bonnierbusinesspress.com/markets/sweden/|publisher=Bonnier Business Press|accessdate=3 July 2016}}</ref>
==Circulation== The 1983 circulation of ''Dagens industri'' was 30,000 copies.<ref name=mgraf>{{cite web|author=Maria Grafström|title=The Development of Swedish Business Journalism|url=http://www.diva-portal.org/smash/get/diva2:645930/FULLTEXT01.pdf|publisher=Uppsala University|accessdate=29 November 2014|format=PhD Thesis|date=2006}}</ref> Its circulation was 100,000 copies in 2000.<ref name=mgraf/> It was 115,000 copies in 2003.<ref>{{cite web|title=World Press Trends|url=http://www.wan-press.org/ecrire/upload/wpt2004.pdf|publisher=World Association of Newspapers|accessdate=15 February 2015|location=Paris|date=2004}}</ref> The paper had a circulation of 117,500 copies on weekdays in 2005.<ref name=swi>{{cite web|title=Swedish mass media |url=http://www.swedenabroad.com/SelectImageX/178411/Swedish_mass_media%5B1%5D.pdf |publisher=Swedish Institute |accessdate=18 November 2014 |date=2006 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130925104744/http://www.swedenabroad.com/SelectImageX/178411/Swedish_mass_media%5B1%5D.pdf |archivedate=25 September 2013 }}</ref> Its circulation was 101,700 copies in 2010.<ref name=ne/>
According to the media survey [[Sifo|Orvesto]], Dagens industri had 328,000 daily readers of their printed issue during the beginning of 2017.<ref name="di">{{cite web|author=Di|title=Om oss|url=http://www.di.se/om-oss/om-oss/|publisher=Di.se University|accessdate=9 August 2017}}</ref>
==References== {{Reflist|refs= <ref name=ne>{{cite encyclopedia |title=Dagens Industri |encyclopedia=[[Nationalencyklopedin]] |language=Swedish |url=http://www.ne.se/dagens-industri |accessdate=25 March 2011}} {{subscription required}}</ref> }}
==External links== *[http://www.di.se Dagens Industri web edition]

Director of [[Oxford United F.C.|Oxford United]] | networth = }} '''Erick Thohir''' (born 30 May 1970) is an Indonesian businessman. He is the founder and chairman of [[Mahaka Media|Mahaka Group]], a holding company which focuses on media and entertainment. He is also the minority owner of [[Inter Milan]], the former owner of [[D.C. United]],, Director of [[Oxford United F.C.|Oxford United]] and President Director of [[antv]]. ==Early and personal life== Erick Thohir was born on 30 May 1970.{{cite news|work=The Jakarta Post |title=Erick Thohir becomes first Asian to own NBA team |url=http://www.thejakartapost.com/news/2011/10/20/erick-thohir-becomes-first-asian-own-c.html |date=20 October 2011 |accessdate=12 January 2012 |archivedate=12 January 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/64czCjvJ0?url=http://www.thejakartapost.com/news/2011/10/20/erick-thohir-becomes-first-asian-own-c.html |deadurl=yes |df=dmy }} He was born in a [[Muslim]] family and is practicing.http://en.abna24.com/service/europe/archive/2015/04/11/682671/story.html His father, Teddy Thohir, was a co-owner of the automotive group [[Astra International]] with [[William Soeryadjaya]].{{cite news |work=Jakarta Globe | title=Indonesian Media Manager a Man On a Mission | url= http://jakartaglobe.beritasatu.com/archive/indonesian-media-manager-a-man-on-a-mission/ | date=22 July 2009 | last=Veda | first=Titania | accessdate=17 August 2016 }} His brother, Garibaldi Thohir, is an investment banker and entrepreneur in the energy sector. He also has a sister, Rika Thohir.{{cite news|work=Globe Asia |title=New media magnates |url=http://www.thejakartaglobe.com/coverstory/new-media-magnates/450026 |date=30 June 2011 |last1=Nonto |first1=Albertus Weldison |last2=Soegiarto |first2=Yanto |accessdate=12 January 2012 |archivedate=12 January 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/64d1eVYy2?url=http://www.thejakartaglobe.com/coverstory/new-media-magnates/450026 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy }} As a child, the younger Thohir helped the family business. Thohir received his master's degree in 1993 from [[National University (California)]], United States. Currently, Thohir's family holding company, TNT Group, has large investments in the Indonesian energy, foods, property and media industries. In 2015, the TNT group had a revenue of $1,1 billion. ==Career== Upon his return to Indonesia, together with his colleagues, he formed the [[Mahaka Media|Mahaka Group]]. In 2001, the Mahaka Group bought ''[[Republika (Indonesian newspaper)|Republika]]'', the biggest Islamic newspaper in [[Indonesia]]. Because of Thohir's background in communications, he was chosen to lead the paper. He received support from his father, as well as founder of ''[[Kompas]]'' Jakob Oetama and founder of ''[[Jawa Pos]]'' [[Dahlan Iskan]] to run this newspaper. The Mahaka Group spread its potential by investing in the outdoor advertising company Mahaka Advertising due to the growth of the economic and the city size in 2002. After launching the television station [[Jak TV]], Mahaka introduced the radio stations [[Gen FM|98.7 Gen FM]] and [[Jak FM|101 Jak FM]], and participated in PT Radionet Cipta Karya ([[Prambors|Prambors FM]], [[Delta FM]] and [[FeMale Radio]]), as well as numerous advertising, ticketing, entertainment and digital companies. Thohir is the founder of Darma Bakti Mahaka Foundation. In 2011, together with [[Anindya Bakrie]] hw co-owned the television stations [[tvOne (Indonesia)|tvOne]], as well as the internet news site [[Viva News]]. In 2014, he was involved in a turnaround project and became the President Director of [[antv]]. In 2018, incumbent president [[Joko Widodo]] picked Thohir as chief of his [[Joko Widodo presidential campaign, 2019|re-election campaign]] for the [[Indonesian presidential election, 2019|2019 presidential election]].{{cite news |title=Indonesia president picks Asian Games chief to run re-election... |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-indonesia-politcs/indonesia-president-picks-asian-games-chief-to-run-re-election-campaign-idUSKCN1LN1N9 |accessdate=7 September 2018 |work=Reuters |date=7 September 2018}} ==Sports team ownership== After negotiations started after the [[2011 NBA All-Star Game]] with former basketball agent [[Jason Levien]] and managing owner [[Joshua Harris (businessman)|Joshua Harris]], Thohir became part of the consortia that bought the [[Philadelphia 76ers]]. The consortia included actor [[Will Smith]], his wife [[Jada Pinkett Smith]],{{cite news |work=Jakarta Globe |title=Media Magnate Breaks New Ground With Philadelphia 76ers |url=http://www.thejakartaglobe.com/sports/media-magnate-breaks-new-ground-with-philadelphia-76ers/473573 |date=23 October 2011 |last=Satwiko |first=Wimbo |accessdate=21 January 2015 |archivedate=12 January 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/64d2bM0PY?url=http://www.thejakartaglobe.com/sports/media-magnate-breaks-new-ground-with-philadelphia-76ers/473573 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy }} [[David S. Blitzer]], of the private equity firm [[Blackstone Group]] and Indonesian businessmen Handy Soetedjo.[http://www.nba.com/sixers/stories/group_led_by_joshua_harris_com_2011_10_18.html ESPN: "Group led by Joshua Harris completes purchase of Sixers"] 18 October 2011 Comcast-Spectacor and Harris began talks in the summer of 2011. The deal was announced on 13 July 2011.[http://espn.go.com/nba/story/_/id/6767259/sale-philadelphia-76ers-joshua-harris-group Sale of 76ers to Joshua Harris finished]. [[ESPN]], 2011-07-13. In addition to his business, he also owns the basketball team, [[Satria Muda Pertamina Jakarta|Satria Muda]], and served as an honorary board member of the [[Indonesian Basketball Association]] ([[Indonesian Basketball Association|PERBASI / Persatuan Bola Basket Seluruh Indonesia]]) from 2015 to 2019.{{cite news|url= http://perbasi.or.id/susunan-pengurus-pp-perbasi/ |title=PP Pengurus PP PERBASI| date=26 February 2016}} He has been President of SEABA (Southeast Asian Basketball Association) since 2006. He was a FIBA board member, Chef De Mission of Indonesia Contingent for the Olympic Games London 2012, and Chairman of National Olympic Committee for 2015–2019. ===Basketball clubs=== * {{flagicon|USA}} [[Philadelphia 76ers]] (formerly, until 2013) * {{flagicon|IDN}} [[Satria Muda BritAma Jakarta|Satria Muda]] ===Football clubs=== * {{flagicon|USA}} [[D.C. United]] (formerly, until 2018){{cite news |last1=Goff |first1=Steven |title=D.C. United announces changes to its investment group |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/soccer-insider/wp/2018/08/07/d-c-united-announces-changes-to-its-investment-group/ |accessdate=10 October 2018 |work=Washington Post |date=7 August 2018 |language=en}} * {{flagicon|Italy}} [[F.C. Internazionale Milano|Inter Milan]] (minority owner) * {{flagicon|Indonesia}} [[Persib Bandung]] (Commissioners){{cite web |title=STRUKTUR ORGANISASI |url=http://www.persib.co.id/clubs/organizational_structure |publisher=Persib Bandung |accessdate=10 October 2018 |language=id}} * {{flagicon|England}} [[Oxford United]] (Board Member){{cite news |title=Erick Thohir: Former Inter Milan owner joins Oxford United board |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46136819 |accessdate=8 November 2018 |work=BBC Sport |date=8 November 2018}} === Chairman of Inter Milan=== In September 2013, [[Inter Milan]] chairman ({{lang-it|presidente|lit=president}}) and owner [[Massimo Moratti]] confirmed that he was in discussions to sell a majority 70% stake in the club to Thohir.{{cite news |work=BBC Sport | title=Inter Milan deny £300m takeover by Erick Thohir has been agreed|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/24176098 | date=20 September 2013 | accessdate=21 January 2015}}{{cite news |title=Moratti vede Thohir. Primo faccia a faccia per l’Inter indonesiana |language=Italian |work=La Gazzetta dello Sport | url=http://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/Squadre/Inter/28-05-2013/moratti-vede-thohir-primo-faccia-faccia-l-inter-indonesiana-20473727399.shtml |date=28 May 2013 |accessdate=21 January 2015}} On 15 October 2013 after a long negotiation, International Sports Capital HK Limited, led by Thohir (for 60% stake), Handy Soetedjo (20%) and Rosan Roeslani (20%), became the majority shareholder of Inter Milan, acquiring a 70% stake of the club by a subscription of new shares.{{cite news |url=http://www.inter.it/en/news/43937 |title=FC Internazionale Milano SpA signs an agreement to open capital to new investors |work=F.C. Internazionale Milano |accessdate=15 October 2013| date=21 January 2015 }} On 15 November 2013, the club's general meeting appointed Thohir as new chairman of the board of directors of [[Inter Milan]], replacing Moratti, who would remain with the club as honorary chairman.{{cite news|url=http://www.corriere.it/sport/13_novembre_15/inter-thohir-nuovo-presidente-nerazzurro-moratti-forse-carica-onorifica-27ba2072-4dea-11e3-a50b-09fe1c737ba4.shtml |title=Inter, Thohir nuovo presidente nerazzurro. Massimo Moratti sarà presidente onorario |work=Corriere della Sera |accessdate=21 January 2015| date=22 November 2013}} Moratti left the position in 2016.{{cn|date=October 2018}} In Thohir's era, [[Javier Zanetti]] was hired as vice-[[president (corporate title)|president]] ({{lang-it|vice-president}} {{sic}}) in 2014. However, in June 2016 Thohir sold part of its stake in Inter Milan to [[Suning Holdings Group]], which was chaired by self-made billionaire [[Zhang Jindong]].{{cite web |url=http://www.inter.it/en/news/53171/suning-holdings-group-acquires-majority-stake-of-f-c-internazionale-milano |title=Suning Holdings Group acquires majority stake of F.C. Internazionale Milano |publisher=F.C. Internazionale Milano |date=6 June 2016 |accessdate=6 June 2016}} Thohir remained as the chairman, despite as the second largest shareholder. In October 2018 Zhang Jindong's son, [[Zhang Kangyang]] (Steven Zhang) became the new chairman replacing Thohir. {{more footnotes|date=October 2010}} A '''Fagan inspection''' is a process of trying to find [[wikt:defect|defects]] in documents (such as [[source code]] or formal specifications) during various phases of the [[software development process]]. It is named after Michael Fagan, who is credited{{by whom|date=November 2018}} with being the inventor of formal [[software inspection]]s.
Fagan inspection defines{{citation needed|date=November 2018}} a process as a certain activity with pre-specified entry and [[exit criteria]]. In every process for which entry and exit criteria are specified, Fagan inspections can be used to validate if the output of the process complies with the exit criteria specified for the process. Fagan inspection uses a group review method to evaluate the output of a given process.{{citation needed|date=November 2018}}
{{portal|Software Testing}}
== Examples == Examples of activities for which Fagan inspection can be used are: * Requirement specification * Software/Information System architecture (for example DYA{{huh|date=November 2018}}){{citation needed|date=November 2018}} * Programming (for example for iterations in [[Extreme Programming|XP]] or [[Dynamic Systems Development Method|DSDM]]) * Software testing (for example when creating test scripts)
== Usage == The [[software development process]] is a typical application of Fagan inspection. As the costs to remedy a defect are up to 10 to 100 times less in the early operations compared to fixing a defect in the maintenance phase<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Fagan|first=M. E.|date=1976|title=Design and code inspections to reduce errors in program development|url=http://dx.doi.org/10.1147/sj.153.0182|journal=IBM Systems Journal|volume=15|issue=3|pages=182–211|doi=10.1147/sj.153.0182|issn=0018-8670}}</ref>, it is essential to find defects as close to the point of insertion as possible. This is done by inspecting the output of each operation and comparing that to the output requirements, or [[exit criteria]], of that operation.
=== Criteria === Entry criteria are the criteria or requirements which must be met to enter a specific process.<ref name="fagan86">{{Cite book|url=http://www.mfagan.com/pdfs/aisi1986.pdf|doi=10.1007/978-3-642-48354-7_14|chapter=Advances in Software Inspections|title=Pioneers and Their Contributions to Software Engineering|pages=335|year=2001|last1=Fagan|first1=Michael E|isbn=978-3-540-42290-7|orig-year=1986}}</ref> For example, for Fagan inspections the high- and low-level documents must comply with specific entry criteria before they can be used for a formal inspection process.
Exit criteria are the criteria or requirements which must be met to complete a specific process. For example, for Fagan inspections the low-level document must comply with specific exit criteria (as specified in the high-level document) before the development process can be taken to the next phase.
The exit criteria are specified in a high-level document, which is then used as the standard to which the operation result (low-level document) is compared during the inspection. Any failure of the low-level document to satisfy the high-level requirements specified in the high-level document are called ''defects''<ref name="fagan86"/> (and can be further categorized as ''major'' or ''minor'' defects). Minor defects do not threaten the correct functioning of the software, but may be small errors such as spelling mistakes or unaesthetic positioning of controls in a [[graphical user interface]].
=== Typical operations === A typical Fagan inspection consists of the following operations:<ref name="fagan86"/> * Planning ** Preparation of materials ** Arranging of participants ** Arranging of meeting place * Overview ** Group education of participants on the materials under review ** Assignment of roles * Preparation ** The participants review the item to be inspected and supporting material to prepare for the meeting noting any questions or possible defects ** The participants prepare their roles * Inspection meeting ** Actual finding of defect * Rework {{Anchor|Rework}} ** Rework is the step in software inspection in which the defects found during the inspection meeting are resolved by the author, designer or programmer. On the basis of the list of defects the low-level document is corrected until the requirements in the high-level document are met. * Follow-up {{Anchor|Follow-up}} ** In the follow-up phase of software inspections all defects found in the inspection meeting should be corrected (as they have been fixed in the rework phase). The moderator is responsible for verifying that this is indeed the case. He should verify that all defects are fixed and no new defects are inserted while trying to fix the initial defects. It is crucial that all defects be corrected, as the costs of fixing them in a later phase of the project can be 10 to 100 times higher compared to the current costs.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Fagan|first=M. E.|date=1976|title=Design and code inspections to reduce errors in program development|url=http://dx.doi.org/10.1147/sj.153.0182|journal=IBM Systems Journal|volume=15|issue=3|pages=182–211|doi=10.1147/sj.153.0182|issn=0018-8670}}</ref>
[[File:Fagan Inspection Simple flow.svg|center|frame|Fagan inspection basic model]]
=== Follow-up === In the follow-up phase of a Fagan inspection, defects fixed in the rework phase should be verified. The moderator is usually responsible for verifying rework. Sometimes fixed work can be accepted without being verified, such as when the defect was trivial. In non-trivial cases, a full re-inspection is performed by the inspection team (not only the moderator).
If verification fails, go back to the rework process.
== Roles == The inspection process is normally performed by members of the same team that is implementing the project. The participants fulfill different roles within the inspection process:<ref>{{cite journal|first=Fagan|last=M.E.|title=Design and Code inspections to reduce errors in program development|year=1976|journal=IBM Systems Journal|volume=15|issue=3|pages=182–211|doi=10.1147/sj.153.0182|url=http://www.mfagan.com/pdfs/ibmfagan.pdf}}</ref><ref>{{cite book|doi=10.1109/SEW.2002.1199450|chapter=An empirical study of modifying the Fagan inspection process and the resulting main effects and interaction effects among defects found, effort required, rate of preparation and inspection, number of team members and product 1st pass quality|title=27th Annual NASA Goddard/IEEE Software Engineering Workshop, 2002. Proceedings|pages=58|year=2003|last1=Eickelmann|first1=N.S|last2=Ruffolo|first2=F|last3=Baik|first3=J|last4=Anant|first4=A|isbn=0-7695-1855-9}}</ref> * Author/Designer/Coder: the person who wrote the low-level document * Reader: paraphrases the low-level document * Reviewers: reviews the low-level document from a testing standpoint * Moderator: responsible for the inspection session, functions as a coach
== Benefits and results == By using inspections the number of errors in the final product can significantly decrease, creating a higher quality product. In the future the team will even be able to avoid errors as the inspection sessions give them insight into the most frequently made errors in both design and coding providing avoidance of error at the root of their occurrence. By continuously improving the inspection process these insights can even further be used <ref name=fagan86 />.
Together with the qualitative benefits mentioned above major "cost improvements" can be reached as the avoidance and earlier detection of errors will reduce the amount of resources needed for debugging in later phases of the project.
In practice very positive results have been reported by large corporations such as IBM,{{citation needed|date=November 2018}} indicating that 80% to 90% of defects can be found and savings in resources up to 25% can be reached.<ref name="fagan86"/>
== Improvements == Although the Fagan inspection method has been proved to be very effective,{{citation needed|date=November 2018}} improvements have been suggested by multiple researchers. Genuchten{{who|date=November 2018}} for example has been researching the usage of an [[Electronic meeting system|Electronic Meeting System]] (EMS) to improve the productivity of the meetings with positive results <ref>{{cite journal|last=Genuchten|first=M |author2=Cornelissen, W |author3=Van Dijk, C|title=Supporting Inspections with an Electronic Meeting System|journal=Journal of Management Information Systems|date=Winter 1997–1998|volume=14|issue=3|pages=165–179|doi=10.1080/07421222.1997.11518179}}</ref>
Other researchers propose the usage of software that keeps a database of detected errors and automatically scans program code for these common errors <ref>{{cite journal|last=Doolan|first=E.P.|title=Experience with Fagan's Inspection Method|journal=Software—Practice and Experience|date=February 1992|volume=22|issue=2|pages=173–182|doi=10.1002/spe.4380220205}}</ref>. This again should result in improved productivity.
== References == {{reflist}}

{{Use British English|date=November 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2014}} {{Spanish name|'''Rainieri'''|'''Marranzini'''}} {{Infobox person | name = Frank Rainieri | honorific-suffix = | image = Inauguración III copa Punta Cana 2012 -. Foto Pedrito Guzmán 0667 (6803692628).jpg | image_size = | alt = | caption = Frank Rainieri with his family | birth_date = ''[[Circa]]'' 1944{{cite news|last1=López|first1=Myriam|title=Grupo Punta Cana: La historia de un soñador|url=http://hoy.com.do/grupo-punta-cana-la-historia-de-un-sonador/|accessdate=9 April 2015|publisher=Hoy|date=21 December 2003|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150409030452/http://hoy.com.do/grupo-punta-cana-la-historia-de-un-sonador/|archivedate=9 April 2015|language=Spanish|quote=Todavía no había cumplido 24 años cuando Frank Rainieri decidió convertir a Punta Cana en un gran destino turístico. Hoy, 35 años después, (...)}} | baptism_date = | birth_place = [[Puerto Plata (city)|Puerto Plata], [[Dominican Republic]] | death_date = | death_place = | death_cause = | body_discovered = | resting_place = | resting_place_coordinates = | nationality = [[People of the Dominican Republic|Dominican]] | citizenship = | education = | alma_mater = [[Saint Joseph's University]]{{cite web|last1=Guerra|first1=Edwin|title=Frank el Conquistador|url=http://www.revistamercado.do/2008/08/frank-el-conquistador/|archive-url=https://archive.is/20141125003100/http://www.revistamercado.do/2008/08/frank-el-conquistador/|dead-url=yes|archive-date=2014-11-25|publisher=Revista Mercado|accessdate=24 November 2014|language=Spanish|date=August 2008}} | occupation = | years_active = | employer = | organization = | agent = | known_for = Founder and developer of [[Punta Cana]] | notable_works = | style = | home_town = | salary = | net_worth = Near [[US$]] 1.0 [[1000000000 (number)|billion]] | height = | weight = | boards = [[Puntacana Group]] | spouse = Haydée Kuret Pacheco{{cite web|last1=Figueroa|first1=Rossana|title=PROTAGONISTA - Haydee Kuret de Rainieri|url=http://www.bavaronews.com/semanal/index.php/impactos/protagonista/914-protagonista-haydee-kuret-de-rainieri|publisher=Bavaro News|accessdate=24 November 2014|language=Spanish}} | partner = | children = Paola, Francesca, and [[Frank Elías Rainieri|Frank Elías]] | parents = Francisco Rainieri, Venecia Marranzini | relatives = † [[Fernando Rainieri]] (brother)
[[Celso Marranzini]] (second-cousin) | callsign = | awards = [[Order of Merit of Duarte, Sánchez and Mella]], [[Order of Christopher Columbus]] | module = | module2 = | module3 = | module4 = | module5 = | module6 = | website = | footnotes = | box_width = }} '''Frank Rafael Rainieri Marranzini''' is a businessman from the [[Dominican Republic]]. He is the chairman and founder of [[Puntacana Group]]. According to ''[[Forbes]]'', Rainieri has one of the ten largest fortunes in the Dominican Republic, with a net worth near the billion-dollar mark.{{cite web |url=https://www.forbes.com.mx/los-proximos-millonarios-de-republica-dominicana/|title=Los próximos millonarios de República Dominicana|trans-title=The upcoming Dominican Republic billionaires|accessdate=24 November 2014|publisher=[[Forbes]]|location=Mexico City|date=26 June 2014|language=Spanish}} In 2015, he was designated [[ambassador]] of the [[Sovereign Military Order of Malta]] to the Dominican Republic, a position that his father also held 4 decades earlier.{{cite journal|last1=Rivera|first1=Rosanna|title=Frank Rainieri: Embajador de la Soberana y Militar Orden Hospitalaria de San Juan de Jerusalén de Rodas y de Malta en República Dominicana|journal=Ritmo Social: Personas & Personalidades|date=18 April 2015|issue=570|page=20|url=http://edition.pagesuite-professional.co.uk/Launch.aspx?pbid=c339b865-2c5e-4e1e-b8d4-04eefcd3ef46|accessdate=18 April 2015|publisher=[[Listín Diario|Editora Listín Diario]]|location=Santo Domingo|language=Spanish|subscription=yes}} ==Early life== Rainieri was born into a family with tradition of hospitality. His paternal grandparents, Isidoro Rainieri and Bianca Franceschini, migrated from [[Bologna]],{{cite web|last1=González Hernández |first1=Julio Amable |title=Apellidos Únicos (7 de 8) |url=http://www.idg.org.do/capsulas/julio2012/julio201221.htm |publisher=Instituto Dominicano de Genealogía |accessdate=13 November 2015 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130308165300/http://www.idg.org.do/capsulas/julio2012/julio201221.htm |archivedate=8 March 2013 |language=Spanish |date=21 July 2012 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy }} [[northern Italy]], to [[northern Dominican Republic]], and established two hotels, one in [[Puerto Plata (city)|Puerto Plata]] and the other in [[Santiago de los Caballeros|Santiago]]; they had more than 10 children.{{cite web|last1=Barletta|first1=María Filomena|title=El centenario de la familia Rainieri|trans-title=The centenary of the Ranieri family|url=http://hoy.com.do/el-centenario-de-la-familia-rainieri/|publisher=Hoy|accessdate=24 November 2014|language=Spanish|date=21 August 2008}} His parents were Francisco Rainieri Franceschini and Venecia Marranzini Lepore (daughter of the Italian immigrants Orazio Michelo Marranzini Inginio and Inmaccolatta Lepore Rodia, who migrated as children with their respective families, all of them natives of [[Santa Lucia di Serino]], in [[southern Italy]]). He went to college in [[Philadelphia]] at Saint Joseph's College, now [[Saint Joseph's University]]. ==Punta Cana== {{See also|Puntacana Resort and Club|Punta Cana}} In 1969, Rainieri and [[Theodore Kheel]],Entrée Magazine. "Tortuga Bay", [[Holiday]], 2009. "The resort was the vision of American labor lawyer Ted Kheel and a spirited, young Dominican named Frank Rainieri." a high-powered New York attorney and labor mediator, acquired a 58-million square meter lot on the eastern end of the Dominican Republic, which was covered with jungle and six miles of beach.[http://www.departures.com/articles/the-dominican-republics-most-luxurious-resort "Dominican Republic’s Most Luxurious Resort"],’’[[Departures Magazine]]’’, Apr 2011. Retrieved on 8 July 2012.Airways Magazine. "Punta Cana Airport: From Jungle to Caribbean Showpiece", May 2009. "Late in the Sixties, Frank Rainieri and Ted Kheel, along with other investors, bought a large parcel of land, for what was then the bargain price of $200,000 at the eastern end of the Dominican Republic, which occupies the eastern part of the Caribbean Island of Hispaniola, itself part of the Greater Antilles archipelago." Their first project was a 40 guest hotel called the Punta Cana Club, inaugurated two years later. In 1979, they constructed The Puntacana Hotel. The [[Punta Cana International Airport]] followed in 1984. In 1997, Rainieri and Kheel partnered with [[Oscar de la Renta]] and [[Julio Iglesias]] to start work on the Punta Cana Marina and the real estate development of the area. == References == {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Rainieri, Frank}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1940s births]] [[Category:Date of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:People from Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic]] [[Category:Dominican Republic people of Italian descent]] [[Category:Saint Joseph's University alumni]] [[Category:Dominican Republic businesspeople]] [[Category:Dominican Republic billionaires]] [[Category:Order of Merit of Duarte, Sánchez and Mella]] [[Category:People of Campanian descent]] [[Category:People of Emilian descent]] [[Category:Ambassadors of the Sovereign Military Order of Malta]] [[Category:Ambassadors to the Dominican Republic]] {{DominicanRepublic-bio-stub}}

Tung Shing Securities (Brokers) Ltd. | awards = | website = | module = | module2 = | module3 = | module4 = | module5 = | module6 = | signature = | signature_size = }} {{Infobox Chinese |t=蕭炯柱 |j=Siu1 Gwing2 cyu5 |y=Sīu Gwíng chyúh |hide=no }} '''Gordon Siu Kwing-chue''', [[Commander of the Most Excellent Order of the British Empire|CBE]], [[Gold Bauhinia Star|GBS]], [[Justice of Peace|JP]] ({{zh-t|蕭炯柱}}; born 29 November 1945) is a former Hong Kong civil servant. From 1993 to 2001, he served as [[Secretary for Commerce and Economic Development|Secretary for Economic Services]], [[Secretary for Transport and Housing|Secretary for Transport]], head of the [[Central Policy Unit]] and [[Secretary for the Environment|Secretary for Planning, Environment and Lands]]. ==Early life== He was born in 1945 and was educated at the [[Birmingham University]]. ==Career== He joined the civil service as an Administrative Officer in 1966. He had served various positions in the government, including the Deputy Secretary for the Civil Service from 1981 to 1985, Secretary General of the [[Office of the Unofficial Members of the Executive and Legislative Councils|Office of Members of the Executive and Legislative Councils]] from 1985 to 1988 and Postmaster General from 1988 to 1992. In 1993, he was appointed [[Secretary for Commerce and Economic Development|Secretary for Economic Services]]. During his service, he was responsible for promoting the construction of the [[Chek Lap Kok Airport]] as the director of New Airport Projects Co-ordination Office, in which the construction plan became an issue of the Sino-British dispute on the eve of the handover. He was later appointed [[Secretary for Transport and Housing|Secretary for Transport]], and head of the [[Central Policy Unit]] from 1997 to 1999 after the handover. He became [[Secretary for the Environment|Secretary for Planning, Environment and Lands]] in 1999 until retired from the government in 2001.{{cite web|title=蕭炯柱，C.B.E., G.B.S., J.P.（永遠榮譽主席）|url=http://www.hkmoy.com/purposes/index.php?p_id=1|work=HKMOY}} Siu was awarded the honours of [[Commander of the Most Excellent Order of the British Empire]] (CBE) in 1997 and [[Gold Bauhinia Star]] (GBS) in 2002 and appointed a non-official Justice of the Peace in 2003. ==Retirement== Since his retirement, he has held directorships in many companies, including China Resources Enterprise Ltd., Transport International Holdings Limited, China Resources Beer (Holdings) Company Limited, ICEA Finance Holdings Limited and ICEA Securities Limited, Tung Shing Securities (Brokers) Limited, [[Television Broadcasts Limited]], The [[Kowloon Motor Bus]] (1933) Ltd. and Long Win Bus Company Limited, subsadries of Kowloon Motor Bus Co. Ltd.{{cite web|work=Bloomberg|title=Kwing Chue Siu GBS, CBE, JP, MSS(Birmingham, UK)|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/people/person.asp?personId=30465052&privcapId=875103}} ==Other Interests== He plays violin and had joined choir in school. He received a diploma from the [[Royal Academy of Music]] and joined the Metropolitan Youth Orchestra in 1964. He went on became the concertmaster of the Orchestra in 1966 and coach in 1968. In 1974, he co-founded the Music for Our Young Foundation with Dr. [[Ding Lik-kiu]] and others. He has been active in music-related works after his retirement. Besides he has also been non-executive director in many companies. In 1977, he was commissioned by [[Governor of Hong Kong|Governor]] [[Murray MacLehose]] to establish the Music Office.{{cite news|url=http://www.scmp.com/news/hong-kong/article/2002897/one-mans-passion-gives-hong-kongs-young-musicians-lesson|title= One man’s passion gives Hong Kong’s young musicians a lesson in multicultural creation |work=South China Morning Post|date=13 August 2016}} ==Personal life== He married [[Sarah Liao]] who was also senior civil servant and became Secretaries for the Environment, Transport and Works from 2002 to 2007. The couple later divorced. ==References== {{reflist}} {{s-start}} {{s-gov}} {{s-bef|before =[[Anson Chan]]}} {{s-ttl|title = [[Secretary for Commerce and Economic Development|Secretary for Economic Services]] |years = 1993–1996}} {{s-aft|after=[[Stephen Ip]]}} {{s-bef|before =[[Haider Barma]]}} {{s-ttl|title = [[Secretary for Transport and Housing|Secretary for Transport]] |years = 1996–1997}} {{s-aft|after=[[Nicholas Ng]]}} {{s-bef|before =[[Bowen Joseph Leung]]}} {{s-ttl|title = [[Secretary for the Environment|Secretary for Planning, Environment and Lands]] |years = 1999}} {{s-aft|after=Himself|as=[[Secretary for Development|Secretary for Planning and Lands]]}} {{s-bef|before =Himself|as=[[Secretary for the Environment|Secretary for Planning, Environment and Lands]]}} {{s-ttl|title = [[Secretary for Development|Secretary for Planning and Lands]] |years = 1999–2001}} {{s-aft|after=[[John Tsang]]}} {{s-end}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Siu, Gordon}} [[Category:1945 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Alumni of the Royal Academy of Music]] [[Category:Alumni of the University of Birmingham]] [[Category:Government officials of Hong Kong]] [[Category:Hong Kong civil servants]] [[Category:Hong Kong businesspeople]] [[Category:Hong Kong musicians]] [[Category:Recipients of the Gold Bauhinia Star]] [[Category:Commanders of the Order of the British Empire]] [[Category:China Resources people]]
